description: This 1968 Chevrolet Corvette Coupe for sale has a 427 C.I. (435 HP) L71 Tri-Power V8 (Numbers Matching), 4 Speed Manual Transmission, Correct Lemans Blue Exterior, Correct Blue Vinyl Bucket Seat Interior, 1 of Only 2,898 L71 1968 Corvettes Produced, Correct Holley R3659A / R4055 Carbs, Delco AM/FM  Radio, T-Tops, Seat Belts, Working Vacuum Wiper Door & Headlights, 4 Wheel Disc Brakes, 15'' Rally Wheels, BF Goodrich Redline Radials, All New Brakes, Calipers & Lines, Rare, L71, Numbers Matching Lemans Blue Corvette Coupe!

350 cu. in. V8 with Cross Fire Injection, 4 speed automatic trans., matching numbers, factory A/C with new freon, cruise control, power windows, door locks, 6 way adjustable drivers seat, telescoping and tilt wheel, rear defogger, and mirrored T-tops with etched design..  Repairs and improvements; front dash speakers, remote alarm, stage 1 performance chip, stainless steel sleeved calipers, braided stainless steel brake lines, brake system flushed and silicone brake fluid added, under carpet heat barrier kit, door panel insulators, T-top sunshades, replaced leather seat covers and foam, new carpet on seat backs, new rear compartment door assemblies, burl wood laminate trim inserts (instrument cluster, center stack, console, and rear speakers), speedometer rebuilt with 165 m.p.h. faceplate, new alternator, rebuilt starter, rebuilt smog pump, K&N low restriction air cleaners, new fuel pump, performancew Hi Voltage distributor kit, (coil, cap, rotor w/bronze terminals), new ignition wires, Champion double platinum spark plugs, new water pump, new A/C compressor w/pressure cycling switch, new evaporator core, new radiator, new hood latch release and emergency release cables, new upper and lower contrlo arm bushings, new BF Goodrich tires, new Cooper spare tire, stainless steel low restriction mufflers, catalytic converter and connecting pipes, new valve cover gaskets, new door lock assemblies, strikers and inner and outer window seals, new window anti rattle bumpers and electric door lock actuators, new door and T-top weather stripping, new throttle position sensor, KYB mono tube gas shocks.  Engine oil & filter have been changed every 2,500 mi., trans fluid & filter and rear gear and posi fluid every 25,000 mi.
1968 CHEVROLET CORVETTE CONVERTIBLE / HARD TOP, MATCHING NUMBERS 327-350HP CODE "HT" 4 SPEED TRANSMISSION, RARE TELESCOPING STEERING WHEEL, AM/FM RADIO, 8" RALLY WHEELS,

LOOKS LIKE ORIGINAL WELL WORN RALLY RED EXTERIOR, WHAT I CALL A HONEST VETTE SHOWING WEAR FROM YEARS OF USE BUT NOT ABUSE. TOPS OF THE DOORS FROM ARMS TOUCHING THE FINISH, A FEW NICKS AND CHIPS, SOME CHECKING THROUGH OUT, BUT THE NOSE HAS NO RIVETS STARTING TO SHOW AT THE LIGHTS.  RUST FREE CHASSIS, THE SMOG PUMP IS OFF, AND IT COMES WITH THE VEHICLE, AND IT IS NOT STUCK.
THE VINYL HARD TOP IS EXCELLENT, THE CONVERTIBLE TOP NEEDS REPLACING, WE HAVE THE NEW FABRIC FOR IT.
TO FIND ONE OF THESE THAT IS NOT ON IT'S SECOND OR THIRD PAINT IS RARE, PANEL FITMENT IS VERY NICE,
THE BLACK INTERIOR STILL LOOKS NICE.THE DASH PAD IS GOOD, DOOR PANELS ALSO REAL NICE.LOCKS WORK PROPERLY.
THE ENGINE HAS GOOD OIL PRESSURE, AND RUNS STRONG. I SEE NO SIGNS OF IT EVER BEING MESSED WITH.
THE CODES ON THE ENGINE 8S416977 MATCH THE VIN TAG, THE ENGINE CODE VO415HT COMES BACK AS 68 CORVETTE 327-350HP 11.0 COMP MANUAL TRANS.
DATA TAG REFLECTS PAINT CODE 974 AS RALLY RED AND STD AS BLACK INTERIOR.
CURRENTLY DRY STORED AT MY FACILITY IN NC, CAN SHIP FROM THERE, OR BRING TO OHIO, GLOBAL TRANSPORT AVAILABLE.
BOB

Very nice restoration! Rare numbers matching convertible with M20 4-speed, C60 factory air, both tops in new condition, N14 factory side exhaust, working U69 Delco AM/FM radio, and A02 Tinted windshield, Base 327 rebuilt less than 2K miles ago. Beautiful looking and driving Corvette! One of the very nicest out there for the money!

GR Auto Gallery is pleased to present this 1977 Chevrolet Corvette for purchase. C3 generation of Corvettes were the stingrays patterned after the Mako Shark II designed by Larry Shinoda and executed under Bill Mitchell's direction. After 1974 government restrictions, the gigantic muscle cars were being scaled back to just cruisers more than road carvers. The C3 Corvette though lived on being advertised as ''a more efficient Corvette'' while still maintaining the bite that wasn't currently being produced elsewhere. The 1977 models featured steel floor panels which reduced interior noise and weighed less than the previous fiberglass floors. Power levels and speed were on the rise while power everything (steering, brakes, etc) made these a pleasure to drive and handle.

This '77 t-top stingray is in excellent condition for its next owner. It's powered by the original 350ci V8 paired with the original turbo-hydramatic 3-speed automatic transmission.  The car runs and handles like a dream.  The 'vette has just recently had a lot of service work and upgrades done to it.  There are as follows: new tires, new chrome rings and the wheels have just been repainted, new upper and lower control arms with new bushings and ball joints, new rear struts, new front springs(touring), new rear springs(touring), new shocks, new front sway bar, new brake calipers(o-ring style), new pads/rotors and front hubs with bearings, new stainless steel brake lines, new rear trailing arms with new bearings, rebuilt differential with 3.08 ratio, new u-joints, new Steeriods rack and pinion steering, rebuilt TH 350 automatic transmission, new transmission cooling lines, new radiator cooling hoses, new valve covers, new alternator, new Vintage air conditioning, new upper dash pad, new lower dash pads, new steering wheel, new center console side, new shift boot, new seat back covers, new stereo with XM and Bluetooth with new front speakers.  There are receipts to document all of this work that was just done.
Cosmetically, the Corvette shows very well.  The car is also equipped with power steering and power brakes and has a luggage rack.
To see over 80 photos of this car, including under carriage please visit our website www.grautogallery.com

Gr Auto Gallery, LLC and our sister company, Wheelz Sales and Leasing Inc. makes every effort to represent each vehicle accurately and with integrity. We also welcome third party inspections when necessary. Although we try to do our very best to be accurate in our description writing we are human and do make mistakes. Unless otherwise noted, All vehicles are sold AS IS, No Warranty Expressed or Implied. All sales final.

Very good restorable convertible with both tops. Small block with matching numbers. Original 4speed transmission in good working condition.  Excellent black leather seats. This is a collectors car not many restorable cars in this condition left.

1961 Chevrolet Corvette Convertible . Red ith white coves, Rebuilt 327 with Aluminum Corvette style radiator. Smooth shifting 4-speed. Solid Southern. California un hit body with rust-free frame !. Beautiful chrome, paint,and interior. Factory Wonder Bar radio. 2 year Hot Rod Power Tour veteran. I have the front liscence plate assembly.  This  is one of the nicest looking and driving  Vette,s that you will ever see! Ready for your enjoyment!  P.S. I have alot of  58-62 Corvette parts than I might sell to the buyer of this car. $47900 call 303-503-8341 will help transport

You don't come across vintage Corvettes in operating condition very often, but this 1968 Chevrolet Corvette Stingray is a truly rare find. With just over 43,000 ACTUAL miles under its belt, it's one highly sought-after piece of automotive culture featuring matching numbers and restored to an outstanding condition that reflects nothing but the best of care.

That factory-correct Rally Red exterior is the same shade this Stingray began life with and it has been brought into the present in top quality form - just the first and most obvious of clues as to how exacting the restoration undertaken on this classic has been. A true American sports car, the Corvette occupied a very distinct space from the more commonly seen muscle cars of their era, so it's fitting that this one retains its stock configuration throughout - a model as special as this certainly needed no help in the form of customization. Its T-Top configuration, with its fold-out rear window, makes it even more special. Light as they are, the T-Tops themselves are easy to take on and off and the option allows for the open-air enjoyment of a convertible, but with a lot less wind noise. All too often, the point at which a classic's restoration is completed marks its zenith, as waning enthusiasm can lead to a diminishing standard of attention down the line. Not with this one.  Obviously the recipient of great care, it has unblemished, shiny chrome bumpers, straight trim and good rubber around the doors to go along with that beautiful paint!

Where vintage interiors are concerned, you'll find this one awfully hard to beat. Red throughout and factory-correct like its exterior, it has also been brought back to its optimum condition. The fresh-looking leather bucket seats are surrounded by examples of timeless design everywhere and as you grip the leather-wrapped Chevy steering wheel, you'll see a one of a kind instrument cluster - almost avionic in design. The speedometer and tachometer sit before you, with the accompanying gauges for fuel level, water temperature, oil pressure and battery charge residing along with the clock in the center console. Those stock gauges are all still fully functional, with surprisingly clear lenses.  You'll see that the factory-installed A/C system is still up and running, blowing out from the registers on each side of that futuristic dash. Look down and you'll see matching red carpeting and floor mats that reflect the same impeccable condition.  Additional driver comfort features include its original AM/FM radio and power windows, both of which also work without a hitch.

The performance concept of this Corvette was represented by a fairly simple equation. Take a Chevy 327 V8, with its 300 factory horses and lower it into the compartment of a car weighing only 3200 lbs, and the result is a vintage car that's an absolute blast to drive. But this 'Vette is about more than straight ahead exhilaration. Chevy obviously put a lot of emphasis on just how cutting edge its sports cars were. The power steering you'd rightfully expect is also accompanied by a fully independent suspension and four-wheel power disc brakes at all four corners - both features not at all commonplace at the time. This 327 sits in an engine compartment that has benefited from the same attention shown elsewhere on the car, its still-stock appearance looking dry and unmarred by leaks. Connected to a 3-speed Turbo Hydramatic transmission, the engine's stock headers lead down to a dual exhaust running the length of an undercarriage that shows that same bone-dry look before culminating in the twin pipes at the rear.  The car sits on a set of 15'' Sting Ray spoke rims, wrapped with all-black Michelin radials.

Looking for a truly unique example of vintage American automotive engineering, one that comes complete with build receipts, restoration photos and even the original Owner's Manual? This Sting Ray is for you. Call today!

For sale is my Laguna Blue 1966 Corvette convertible with a $20,000 body-on restoration completed in 2011.  It has a navy interior with white top and has a numbers matching 327 cubic inch 300 horsepower engine with four speed Muncie gearbox, side pipes, AM/FM radio, rare V74 four way flasher with red interior flasher jewel, rare factory headrests (1100 that first year) and added power steering and power brakes.  The Vin number is 194676S107693. I have owned the car since 2009 and its history can be traced to 1986. The original mileage is unknown but she does not burn oil. She starts readily and runs flawlessly. The restoration work is documented along with the history.  Restoration details are too numerous to completely list. Highlights include new paint, glass, electrical harness, and headlight assemblies and motors. Headlights were converted to halogen; clock and radio are stock but rebuilt with updated electronics. Standard appearing speaker but with woofer and tweeter, new brakes and brake lines, tires and battery, tie rod ends, idler arms, rotors and calipers, brake pads and wheel bearings. Frame is solid with only normal surface rust. Chrome is almost perfect.  Interior is in good condition and believed to be original except for two replaced gauges and carpet. Overall it is an excellent but not perfect car, stopping short of show quality. Unexpected sale due to of a gift of a '41 Lincoln Continental taking more than its share of garage space. Will gladly provide Charleston airport pick up and return if you would like to see the car. I do not think you will be disappointed.
All vehicle trades considered, including classics and performance.  I can assist with financing and transport as needed.

Take a good look at this one! This exceptional 1973 Corvette has been through a complete frame-off restoration, with just a few hundred miles since completion. This project was twelve years in the making, starting with a stock Medium Blue car and modest ambitions. But as car projects often go, the scope (and cost) quickly grew. In addition to loads of new or rebuilt parts, this Corvette also received a great collection of performance parts; 400+ hp stroker engine, composite monospring front suspension, custom exhaust, adjustable rear suspension, and more.

The car looks fantastic. It was completely repainted in 2011 at a cost of $10,669. Note the fiberglass nose in place of the urethane bumper, smoothed into the front of the car for a sleek bumperless look. The rust-free frame was cleaned up and painted with POR-15. New parts are in abundance; body mounts, bushings, seals, weatherstripping, rear bumpers, emblems, lenses, mirrors, exhaust tips, and more. The Rally wheels have also been refinished and look excellent with the Mickey Thompson P225/70R15 tires.

Under the hood is a performance-built 383 cubic inch stroker motor. This was a professional build and includes a list of components and tolerances. The new style block was bored +0.030" along with a 0.010" cut on the steel crankshaft. The rotating assembly uses Icon forged pistons and a Bullet Racing hydraulic roller camshaft. There is also an Edelbrock intake, Holley carburetor, Hooker coated headers, and an 8-quart oil pan. Cooling uses a Be Cool aluminum radiator, Flex-A-Lite fan, and shroud.

The transmission is a Muncie 4-speed that uses a new dual friction clutch, pressure plate, and release bearing. There is also a rebuilt differential with new half shafts. Other new or rebuilt parts include brake lines, cables, fuel lines, calipers, rotors, master cylinder, power booster, electric fuel pump, fuel tank, sending unit; too much to list!

My favorite modification on this Corvette has to be the VBP front suspension. This converts the old coil spring setup to a modern composite monoleaf (like a modern Corvette). The difference in ride and handling is tremendous! The rear suspension has also been rebuilt and includes adjustable strut rods. The power steering is essentially stock. As with the rest of the car, new parts abound; bushings, shocks, rear spring, steering control valve, etc.

The interior has been completely redone as well. Of course, there are new seats, new door panels, and new carpeting with FatMat sound deadener underneath. But as with the theme, there is no shortage of other new items; console, sunvisors, sill plates, window hardware, brackets, hinges, switches, and so on.

I have a binder full of receipts large and small, and the asking price is a fraction of the total investment. Obviously a ton of time and money has been put into this Corvette, resulting in a fantastic C3 that you will want to drive every chance you get.
All vehicle trades considered, including classics and performance.  I can assist with financing and transport as needed.

Here is an old-school 1969 Corvette 4-speed that is all set for weekend fun. Having one owner since 1994, this car is an original L46 350hp model with a replacement block and a variety of recent maintenance.

The frame appears nice and solid car, while the body has one older Tuxedo Black repaint. It shows its age in places with some localized chips and cracks, but is very sharp from a few feet away. I think the black color really looks great on an early chrome bumper C3 like this one. Side pipes were added at some point along with Keystone Klassic wheels (the original Rally wheels are included).

This was a 350hp car from the factory. The original engine block was replaced in 1997 when a connecting rod let go. The 4-speed transmission and rear end appear original. The car just received a new aluminum radiator along with a complete radiator support. The brakes were recently serviced and the parking brake cables are new. Note this Corvette has manual steering / manual brakes so you are very in touch with the road.

The interior is code ZQ4 black vinyl. This is a basic C3 setup with a fixed steering column and manual windows, along with lap and shoulder belts. The seats have been replaced as has the shifter handle. The headlights and doors work properly too.

This classic Corvette is a nice driver with just a few minor needs. The vacuum wiper door works but must be operated manually. Also the fiber optics are not very bright (fairly typical) and the radio and clock are not working. It makes for a nice way to get into a classic steel-bumper Stingray for less than $20k.
Just arrived 1965 Corvette Stingray Convertible  pictures and video soon
1966 Chevrolet Corvette 194676S118628 for sale.

This 1964 Chevrolet Corvette Convertible for sale has a 5.7 Liter ZZ4 Crate V8 w/ 4BBL Carb, 4 Speed Manual Transmission, 3.08:1 Posi Rear End, Correct Riverside Red Exterior, Correct Black Vinyl Interior, AM/FM Radio, Power Windows, New Carpet / Interior, 15'' Body Colored Steel Wheels w/ Spinner Hubcaps, White Wall Radial Tires, Edelbrock 4BBL Carb, Newer Soft Top, Reverse Lights, Beautiful Mid Year Convertible w/ a Fresh Crate V8 & Correct Color Combination!

While the value price on this 1979 Chevrolet Corvette likely grabbed your attention, when you dig deeper, you're going to find a survivor-grade coupe with all the right features – including its original V8 and a loaded interior.

The C3 Corvette is one of the most recognizable shapes of all time. This one still fits together as well as it did when it was new, with decent gaps and flush-fitting headlight doors that are a big part of the look.  We're also a big fan of the fastback styling.  The metallic silver paint was one of the best colors on the later C3s, and it has helped this shark-nosed classic look cool in modern times.  This is believed to be mostly the original factory paintjob.  So it might show some age compared to other cars, but most of us give survivor cars some serious bonus points from at the Corvette shows.

Inside you can tell plenty of option boxes were checked off on this one.  It starts with giving you the choice between body-colored roof panels or glass T-tops (with storage bags.)  But our preference is to have these out and the car open to the world.   That way you get to showcase the great color combo of the black interior against the silver paint.  The comfortable bucket seats demonstrate the underlying feeling that makes this Corvette special – a well-respected and maintained classic.  This is seen throughout the interior with its door panels, carpeting, and full gauge cluster looking quite original and complete.  Even the optional AM/FM stereo with 8-track player is even still in place.  While that's more of a novelty today, the more luxurious options include the power windows, power locks, and provisions for factory air conditioning.

Lift the hood, and this collector's car looks like a time capsule.  The 350 cubic-inch motor is numbers-matching, and looks like it has been kept original right down to the factory decals. This V8 appears only to have been given good routine maintenance, including newer hoses and belts.  In fact, with this kind of condition, it's quite easy to believe that the low mileage is actual.  The V8 inhales deeply through a correct Quadrajet four-barrel carburetor, and it exhales with authority out of the dual exhaust tips.  This is mated to its correct TH350 three-speed automatic that is always able to handle the torque this V8 can throw down.  Chevy built these to be great cruising cars, and so the fully independent suspension, power steering, BF Goodrich T/As on Rally wheels, and four-wheel disc brakes really make you want to drive this coupe every weekend.

Complete with the original warranty card, owner's manual, and other original docs, you're looking at a survivor-grade classic that's also a tempting driver.  And so when this package is priced so right, you know you need to hurry on this deal.  Call today!!!
